wikipedia_page.main: Lady Louisa Sophia Goldsmid (2 September 1819 – 12 June 1908) was a British philanthropist and education activist who targeted her life at improving education provision for British women. She took a leading role in persuading Cambridge University to create women graduates.

response: He married his first cousin Louisa Sophia Goldsmid on 10 October 1839 at London, England.
